page.title: 14EMPLOYMENT IN YATTON
page.content: In the olden days most of the inhabitants of Yatton would have been employed in agricultre.At the time of the Industrial Revolution a furniture factory was established,initially manufacturing church pews and school desks. The successor to this company, Avalon furniture,closed in 1985, throwing many people out of work. However, a computer firm may take over.Another local industry is the Titan ladder factory. Recently,two sites containing small industrial units have been established in Yatton, and a double glazing firm has expanded its offices and factory .However, most of the working people in Yatton commute to Clevedon,Weston-super-Mare or Bristol.Part time employment is available in the local shops, country club and garden centre.
